result.execSummary:
The defendant Frankie J. Bildeau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Not to consume/possess any controlled substances. Not to consume any alcohol.

Defendant Frankie J. Bildeau in court with attorney Chad C La Lor.  Defendant Frankie J. Bildeau in custody.  Angeline E Winton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  No additions or corrections by the state. Atty La Lor speaks to the court. Off record so def. can review the PSI w/ attorney. Back on record at 3:37pm.  Court speaks to the parties. No corrections to the packet. Court speaks to the state.
State speaks re: sentencing-requesting prison time.  Atty La Lor speaks to the court.  Delores Mosay speaks to the court on behalf of the defendant.  Steve Bildeau speaks to the court on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant speaks to the court. Court sentences the defendant.


Sentencing-

1 1/2 years of initial confinement and 2 years of extended supervision

Eligible for programs.

Judgment for costs. 



151 Days credit

Defendant Frankie J. Bildeau in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Frankie J. Bildeau in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Argument from Atty Hoffman. Court speaks to the parties.
Motion to surpress statements is denied.  Court denies each of the search motions.
Motion to modify bail is discussed.  Atty Hoffman speaks to the court.  State speaks to the court.   Based on the facts the court amends the defendant's bond.
